document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

5A7166539A364C189F749C01509970BB.description:
Show God’s love for all
people through words and actions.

1B69FB776BF84D8C9194B98FEE750019.description:
Recognize that Jesus calls
us to serve God and all God’s people.

970A04EF047D4D96AF1BF9A5D2484C2F.description:
Know that God made all
people, and we are called to be kind and loving
to all people.

3F3CE00E673747B1B54E3EBA8E4DB07D.description:
CALL TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849, 927-933, 905,
2044,2472]

AE839B40E1C24FEA9B1F975E2079A476.description:
Participate in and reflect on
service and how we can be Jesus for others.

CBDA8ADF61424F7988BA8A7E82387AF3.description:
Begin to name our unique gifts
that God provides us to help others.

66B32FEE3BEB459886CB0798A2FD94A9.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
Social Teaching about
the common good
[1905-1948, 2419-2422]
Scripture
Mt. 5:3-12

E97276A8AB2F42CFAF264CAE62B2150D.description:
Begin to understand that the
Church has a mission given to her by Jesus
Christ.

C4F07B6AF7BC4F8C9019EAF6EDE71893.description:
By Baptism, we are given
new life as God’s children.

E28A021F93A34F879BD177D1B1CF443C.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816-849]
Scripture
Mt. 28: 19-20

62D21E0F9EDE470A9D5F966290B9DD7C.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6 – THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

02239C1F070C4026922C6A19242D79CD.description:
Begin to understand that Mary is
the Mother of Jesus, Mother of God and our
Mother.

374162D5C9F74B919526C293EF9DF272.description:
MARY AS MODEL OF
THE CHURCH
[148-149, 963-975, 2673-
2682]
Scripture
Lk. 1:26-38

F242B4621F044C3EA13E6E93FDC98F70.description:
Listen to stories of saints as
heroes of our faith who are part of the family of
the Church in heaven.

E483FBC5726A4481A91C0B1FD7349A30.description:
Begin to understand that both
the priest and their parents serve God by taking
care of others in their roles.

1C3FB8ADC3374D15B58748A5661AA163.description:
Begin to understand the word
“holy” as being close to God.

329DC0A303964DD781E538671656FE70.description:
The
Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014, 2028, 2813]
Scripture
1 Peter 1:15-16
Leviticus 11:44

22C469F2526843D8A3A79377EA310D3A.description:
Begin to understand Mary as
part of the Holy Family.

11874A195F75485E96C484250686AB39.description:
Understand that Jesus grew
up in a loving family.

2D5037B968CB42FDBE647AEAA23BEBFA.description:
Begin to understand that
Sunday is an important day to be with God and
to go to Church.

170E711BB698442DAB0923DD5C5D2ECF.description:
Begin to identify the
Archbishop and recognize his role as the leader
of our Archdiocese, the local Church.

7F5180EC046C44A1B7B88A447E256BC2.description:
Church Order: The
Hierarchy and
Magisterium and
Infallibility
[874-896]

8190E223F3914384AA6AA8DE65EA1486.description:
CHRIST’S
FAITHFUL:
HEIRARCHY, LAITY,
CONSECRATED LIFE
[871-945]

97B4EBEEF76742E09D01A3D2CD63F0F5.description:
Begin to understand “holy” in
reference to the Church.

FC0C74208B13420EAFC225F3D86215FE.description: THE MYSTERY AND MARKS OF THE CHURCH: One, Holy, Catholic, Apostolic [811-870]

668ECFEC8C8F452181410DAAAED780CD.description:
Recognize that God loves us
so much that the Holy Spirit lives in each of us.

6612ADB189AD4ADE91D5C006A758BEEF.description:
Temple of the Holy
Spirit [797-801]
Scripture
1 Cor. 6:19

5EF79127343F4087AE3C2E483445156F.description:
Experience “Body of Christ” as
who we are when we pray together and use our
hands to help others.

6CDE132AB5224DD89B71D0FAE6E862F4.description:
Associate their parish church
as the place where their community, God’s
family, joins in prayer together.

477142ADC9B84F10B41E7DE3A59DE7DC.description:
Identify Church as a place
where all people join together to worship, to
thank God, to serve God, and to serve one
another.

77A9EE4D39D14117AF5FCCEA82CD1619.description:
Begin to understand the word
history as the story of the past.

AD7303B0A74D4777A3CB146D315D4198.description:
Listen to stories about the parish
patron saint.

87DE128CA336487EAA49F667AF7D7609.description:
THE CHURCH IN
GOD’S PLAN [748-780]
Church History
[758-780]

2A0A8B53D2284C53A0CBF785478EBD4D.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 5 – EDUCATING FOR THE LIFE, COMMUNITY, AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

493898311F9746E9814525B566FDFA25.description: Invitation to Liturgy of the Hours

0355961B19F6416890F244AF0EBB299F.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise,
intercession, thanksgiving, petition

F322B7D0324D444FBFC05CEE45D378FE.description:
PRAYERS WE KNOW
BY HEART,
EXPERIENCE AND
SHARE AT MASS

7A4DF078C3EE418E945E993E6A89DFDA.description:
Begin to participate in devotional
practices, short communal prayers related to
the Rosary or Stations of the Cross.

4B3E566D530B4B569A858280AC8134EB.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas,
Simbang Gabi, etc.)
[1200-1209,1674-1679,
2683-2696]

E0770D792AB242198D29946FD2525A56.description:
Begin to recognize the Our Father is
a prayer we say at Mass and in our daily lives.

6B0E1CE903044130AF19F0A9F781E0CF.description:
OUR FATHER:
SUMMARY OF THE
GOSPEL
[2746-2865]
Scripture:
Mt. 6:9-14
Lk. 1:28, 42, 11: 1-4

4C51902641DD4CC2B0672FDE0FF90BF0.description:
Experience prayer with music and in
short periods of silence.

BDBA8FC2ABB9429CAA1D27C170DBDA59.description:
Recognize that we pray at home, at
school and at church.

1B06030B3DED41508FC4CB2DBBDE7B88.description:
EXPRESSIONS OF
PRAYER, PROCESS
Personal, Shared,
Vocal, Singing,
Meditation
2700-2724]

05900334D82C479AA90D7B990AA45CC3.description:
Know that through prayer we thank
God for our many gifts, and we ask God to help
us with our worries.

9D8E1AE2553F4203B08263A96834A2DE.description: Spend time with God in prayer.

28C814328C88456CA5DFD80DBB65D5D2.description:
FORMS OF PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]

6F21100473AF4A2FA5B5B2CC2A3C63B8.description:
Listen to and participate in prayers
and recognize that prayer is important.

78B8377BDD35467D830FFC36DFE75119.description:
Begin to understand that prayer is
talking to God.

65F0003F9F884FC0ABAD9374CB57F2E5.description:
THE UNIVERSAL CALL
TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]
Scripture:
Mt. 6: 5-15

2A407EDAB9AD4A31A73D358B4D6A0519.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

08F4DB59DFE4472BAE6101A96665EFE3.description:
Begin to understand, participate in
and reflect on service to help care for all God’s
people, creatures and world.

1BDF0A77F1EB476F821F2E2C01682C62.description:
Show the importance of sharing and
respecting classroom materials and school
resources.

FBE946808E41422FBBA39B27553F9E62.description:
Begin to understand that God
created all people, creatures and the world as a gift
for us all.

193168BE05724B938E656BAF201D9CFF.description:
Catholic Social Teaching –
Consistent Ethic of Life,
Love of Neighbor, and
Corporal and Spiritual
Works of Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-18; 2: 1-25

132502FA975E40F5B78D14DBC9D30364.description:
Begin to understand the word sin
referring to when we hurt others and don’t listen to
God.

0C751E2D658749B38ABBD0E9EA0FCB8E.description:
Personal and Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25; 3:1-24
Lk. 15: 11-32

31DA6ED5175E4668969D1CEC2734B16B.description:
Demonstrate awareness of the needs
and feelings of others.

F25005922A364B83A7FA75C80EEFCD2B.description:
Begin to recognize the word virtue
as a gift from God to do good things.

C47289469D5A47A0A5327958DAB47B08.description:
Virtues Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture
Micah 6:8
Mt. 5: 1-12

7C6464D0C9294102A4FF8E2391099EEF.description:
Compare the reason for and the
purpose of the Ten Commandments with rules at
home and at school.

52D90BFD9F254FC38ADAEB9D3F7E9D15.description:
Covenant and Ten
Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture
Ex.2-24
Ex. 19:16-20:17
Mt. 22:34-40
Mk. 10: 17-20
Lk. 10:25-28

113F088D655F46FDBA60E18D8DF99126.description:
Name times when they can ask God
to help them obey their parents and to treat others
with kindness.

A646391BEB4644158DBEFF9109166392.description:
Begin to name and distinguish right
(good) from wrong (sinful) actions.

81B234F5AB924BD9AB0E6B85FBA75C81.description:
Human
Freedom and
Conscience Formation
[1030-1037, 1730-1802]
Scripture
Gen. 6:9-9:17

9FF328B3E9B24467AA5C20A753D8054A.description:
Begin to associate happiness with
loving and being close to God and other people.

8A6BE3D1F7E147F0AF00827EFD3A820A.description:
Made for Happiness with
God, Beatitudes
[1218-1229, 1716-1717]
Scripture
2 Cor. 4:4
Mt. 5: 1-12

120F7B81F9324512951014A1C2096C79.description:
Understand how saying a kind word
to someone or doing a good deed is a way to show
God’s love.

BC8A54C6C7964F36A184B389F74416E2.description:
Made in the Image of God
– Foundation of Human
Dignity
 [355-368,1004,1700-1876]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-2:3
Col. 1:15

9B641DA5CD2A44169994B24C5737AE57.description:
Begin to understand that God made us
to know and to love Him.

E197EDA49C2E4AE7912D19F0CA76D23B.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3: MORAL EDUCATION: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled in a
personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society.

4A5DB44F380B49BB99E5F699AD05ECD8.description:
Bow their heads when blessed by
the pastor, their parents or teachers.

21917FC84F7842D6A5E8FA821F7F8B73.description:
Liturgical Rites: Weddings,
Funerals and Blessings
[1671-1673]

D250FA4B7E7E4B91891C7AD769FD661D.description:
Prayerfully listen to Psalm 117 and
respond “Halleluiah!”

ABF809B79C334B7D87D5FEAF1DBD59C7.description:
Divine Office Liturgy of the
Hours
[1174-1178] Scripture:
Psalms 117, 150, 100

96606C8A616344AD848C366D696E80A2.description:
Begin to recognize items in the
classroom, church and at home that are “holy” and
regard them with reverence.

52D94C90165B4ECB839BB4E3B80167A4.description:
Begin to associate the different
colors with the different seasons of the Church
year.

43BA17A906244DA7AE23C15AC0B0966A.description:
Identify the special seasons in the
Liturgical Calendar: Advent, Christmas,
Epiphany, Lent and Easter and special feasts of
Mary and the saints.

7836220BAD974A8A9B69B5BC0334B9E0.description:
Liturgical Calendar
[1163-1173]
Scripture:
Mk. 16:1-8
Lk. 24: 1-53
Jn . 20:1-10

CE0E4C1F4A4B4448A844680730E9B844.description:
Begin to recognize that God has
given us parents and a pastor to show us how to
love others.

E9534BD3C69E4E86A6E7C053C0330835.description:
Sacraments at the Service
of Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:18-24
Mt. 19:4-6; 28:16-20

2A7ED1DBD473455191EE7DC0F8098AEF.description:
Begin to understand that Jesus loves
us always and forgives us.

4BD70AD290B444918050AC1AD65A2F7B.description:
Sacraments of Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]
Scripture:
Ps. 32
Mk. 2:1-12

6F57A109768B437AAD89E8C3B8811A38.description:
Begin to understand that Baptism is
a sacrament.

65304637B78A4049A21F1A17EB662B9F.description:
Begin to understand the definition of a
Sacrament.

D8FECE8891AA4D2DADDF3A33001ED621.description:
Begin to identify the altar, chalice,
tabernacle, ciborium, pall, priest’s vestments,
crucifix, and ambo in pictures or in person.

D3C230F1397447ADA30B9B655A674AEF.description:
Begin to recite grade level Mass
responses. (See Task 4: Teaching to Pray.)

F7994B60D51E4030BCCEEF4ED6683492.description:
Associate the parish priest with the
Mass and be able to identify what he does within
the Church.

A91DEC63A1FC49C0AFED3F57EAD4A8B7.description:
Experience Mass where we worship
and thank God.

7467FEE390C14870AF6353986BA3C07E.description:
EUCHARIST
Who, How, When, and
Where the Mass is
Celebrated
[1135-1167,1322-1419]
Scripture:
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
Jn. 6:32-58
Acts 2:42-47

5D51FDA6C1E34076A02F3A5C7351B97D.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and conscious
participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

AF21CF2A5850422BB44FD914F292140E.description:
Begin to understand that the word
“Creed” means what we believe as Catholics.

8AD396C50A5742E8A36835AD9FB60726.description:
THE CREED: A
Statement of Our Belief
[185-1065]

224A65DA59B94669A198F9938B83C77F.description:
Become familiar with and show
reverence for the names of the three Divine
Persons: God the Father, God the Son (Jesus
Christ) and God the Holy Spirit.

3BFF7D9B2FE84744940F94F47F56893E.description: Repeat the Sign of the Cross.

A6A1B8A6E431413B9ED11D4A00ADD31F.description:
TRINITY:
God the Creator
Jesus the Redeemer,
and Holy Spirit
Sanctifier
[249‐324]
Scripture:
Gen. 1:1-31, 2:1-25
Lk 1:26-38; 2:1-20;
2:41-52
Mt. 1:18-2:15; 3:13-1
Mk 14:32-36
Acts 2:1-42

9B9FE60FE155438EACFCFED23251F957.description:
Listen to the stories of Jesus who
died on the Cross for us, rose from the dead,
and ascended into Heaven.

22871B7624C044368505BA3E20FE8AE0.description:
Begin to understand that Jesus is
God and man, Son of God and Son of Mary.

D03D0BA6985848AA8750F23B558659D5.description:
Begin to understand that Jesus
came to live on earth because He wanted to
share God’s love with us.

DFB491D83F414F5BA6418905AEA90862.description:
Begin to understand the Bible as
the book which contains the stories of God’s
creation and of Jesus’ life.

0904F4A9F13E45958C0363E7FD5044BE.description:
Salvation History
[50‐73]
Scripture:
Old Testament
New Testament

5B4FFE3531A246258364CE91F04C63F2.description:
Begin to understand the Bible is
the holy book that talks about God and creation.

1A5FCD7E2D474D34A19432E8A72B1B18.description:
Sacred Scripture
[101‐141]
Scripture:
Old Testament
New Testament

BB39A4A4A9784CDBADB04CFBFE63F4AD.description:
Begin to understand that angels
have been created by God and that God has
given each of us a Guardian Angel to watch
over and protect us.

8F745BA2DE8042F9BB84F9A7E2930B04.description:
Begin to understand that God created
me, others and all I see.

C864E300E51F40A7B5E38056CF86AA9C.description:
Begin to understand that God created
the world because he loves us. (creation).

93CB70E6DF8040A5A544720104E6B2F0.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1: KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students will explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
